posts.cooked:
It seems there has been some code detected inside the latest Skype for Windows hinting at a potential shutdown of the app and the service in May:

Spotted by a savvy reader and verified by XDA, there‚Äôs a message inside of the latest Skype for Windows preview that says, ‚ÄúStarting in May, Skype will no longer be available. Continue your calls and chats in Teams.‚Äù That‚Äôs followed by a note that a certain number ‚Äúof your friends have already moved to Teams free‚Äù, presumably based on your contacts.

XDA ‚Äì 28 Feb 25

Exclusive: Microsoft is finally shutting down Skype in May

Feel free to use Teams

Edit:

Now confirmed.

‚ÄùSkype users will be in control, they‚Äôll have the choice,‚Äù says Jeff Teper, president of Microsoft 365 collaborative apps and platforms, in an interview with The Verge. ‚ÄúThey can migrate their conversation history and their contacts out and move on if they want, or they can migrate to Teams.‚Äù

Skype will remain online until May 5th, so existing users will have around 60 days to decide whether they want to switch to Microsoft Teams or export their data. ‚ÄúIf they do want to come to Teams then the first-run is pretty instantaneous because we‚Äôve already done the work on the backend to restore their contacts, message history, and call logs,‚Äù says Amit Fulay, vice president of product at Microsoft.

The Verge ‚Äì 28 Feb 25

Microsoft is shutting down Skype

The end of the Skype era.

posts.cooked: Signal should use this news to promote themselves to more people on Twitter, and highlight how Signal allows up to 50 devices/people, how Microsoft Teams probably has Ai integration which is collecting and analysing their data, etc etc

I think it‚Äôs a great pity that Skype is being taken out of circulation. Long before it was bought by M$, it shone with its security standard of the time: decentralization and encryption. After the takeover by M$, if I‚Äôm not mistaken, the latter came to an end. From that moment on, I only used Skype in paid mode. I liked the rates for overseas calls. Especially for people who didn‚Äôt use a smartphone or weren‚Äôt willing to use Signal, because everyone uses ‚ÄúWhatsApp‚Äù. When the Signal code was to be implemented in Skype, Skype became more interesting for me again. However, I didn‚Äôt follow up on what became of it.

It‚Äôs a shame that Skype will be over from May. May it find peace in software heaven.

posts.name: Chris
posts.cooked: I do think that marketing for Signal has fallen unhelpfully as of late and if the GoG Galaxy storefront can purchase a public ad in Times Square for Dino Crisis then Meredith and co. can figure something out.
